ratings.comment: Incredibly unclear lectures, hardly ever explains important terminology, and expects considerably too much background knowledge.

Dr. Simon is a nice guy who obviously knows the material well, but struggles to present it in a consistent and comprehensible way. Often spends little time introducing terminology and just sort of jumps right into the concepts. Reading the book and doing the practice problems will be a lot more helpful than attending lecture, so find time to do it.
Monotone, not engaging, leaves the important material for online mini-lectures. Worst experience of Biocore so far.

Worst experience of Biocore so far. It doesn't help that he's teaching one of the more complicated subjects. Almost everything that he should be teaching in lecture is in online lectures made by his grad student. Then in lecture he just bumbles around in circles without ever actually making a point. The test was hard, but not unreasonable.

Absolutely terrible. The test was extremely unfair and covered probably 10% of what was covered in lecture. The other 90% you have to find out on your own. He is also an extremely dull lecturer. Good luck staying awake.
I'll admit, his lectures are not the most engaging or clear. The secret to understanding this material is to go to his office hours and talk with him. This worked well for me.

Dr. Simon is a great professor, very willing to help, very approachable and knowledgeable. He's also just a cool guy in general. People need to stop expecting to be entertained in lecture. Find some other way to get entertained! Genetics concepts can be difficult and he does a great job presenting them. It's too bad the genetics unit wasn't longer.
Horrible teacher. If you want to learn this stuff, get extra books with extra practice problems because Simon will in no way teach the material that you will see on the test.

Puts together lucid and informative lectures. Terrible at answering non-one-on-one questions and relatability. Has an extended way of communicating...gotta stay focused on lecture. Didn't use the book at all. Youtube videos help more. Requires a lot to be learned on your own.

Worst professor I have ever been with. Past tests were really manageable, but he decided to change things up this year. If you can answer the epistasis between nori and lettuc you'll get an A in the test, if not...that's the least of your worries. Totally unprepared for what he put on the test. He is the sole reason not to enroll in Biocore.

During every lecture for 5 weeks we were subjected to the same monotone voice, incomprehensible genetics material, and a ceaseless repetition of images.  Thankfully, the midterm was easier than expected because genetics is tough.
He's alright- the monotone is hard to deal with at 8:50am, but it's really interesting material. Read the book, do the problem sets, and you'll be fine.

Don't get me wrong, Simon knows the material and he knows it well. As stated before, though, he can't relate to students. You feel as though you need a thesaurus for all the different ways he states the same thing. Just read the book, and you'll be fine.

Simon knows his stuff, but he isn't very good at relating to students... he's not a professor that makes you excited about going to lecture at 8:50.  The book is helpful for clarification if your mind wanders or you fall asleep during class during the genetics section!

He sucks. That's all there is to it. Genetics is a really interesting topic, but he makes lecture so unbelievably boring. He also does a good job of making easy concepts complicated. You will probably do better on your exam by not going to lecture and reading your book, which is very helpful. He is the worst part of the Biocore 301 experience.

I purposely sat by the wall in lecture every MWF, because I knew I was going to fall asleep.  His monotone voice is equivalent to a couple doses of nightquill.  I dreaded going to lecture and really, I don't even know why I went.  And then the days I did stay up to pay attention, I almost started to cry because I was so miserable...and I don't cry.
The dullest lecturer at the university.  Takes what could be interesting subject matter and makes it thoroughly unenjoyable.  Likes to ask impossible questions with karyotypes.
Interesting subject, but not a great lecturer.  He didn't seem very enthusiastic about the material, and it made it hard to pay attention and stay focused during lecture.
